summary: The document is a classified CIA report from August 23, 1962, focusing on Vietnamese Communist (VC) activities in the Saigon area. It details the infiltration of over five hundred unarmed VC members into Saigon, their living conditions in the Fourth and Eight Districts, and their potential involvement in sabotage and kidnappings. Additionally, it covers the formation of special operations cells, the training of VC cadres, and an unverified report about the appointment of Brigadier General Nguyen Trong Dinh as the commander of the South Vietnam Liberation Army for a planned large-scale attack during the VC Fall and Winter campaign.
key_findings: Over five hundred unarmed Vietnamese Communists infiltrated the Saigon area in June 1962.
VC members resided in the homes of fellow VC in the Fourth and Eight Districts of Saigon.
A VC cadre, trained in Loc Thuan, Tay Ninh Province, was dispatched to Saigon to establish a base among laborers.
Forty VC guerrillas, aged 15 to 16, were reportedly in Saigon to carry out sabotage and kidnappings.
An unconfirmed report indicated the appointment of Brigadier General Nguyen Trong Dinh as commander of the South Vietnam Liberation Army for a large-scale attack.
